Diese Ansicht dient der Vorbereitung der Kartentransaktionen f√ºr den Export in die Buchhaltung. Auf dieser Seite werden die f√ºr die Vorkontierung relevanten Informationen in den entsprechenden Spalten angezeigt. Die einzelnen Transaktionen k√∂nnen auf dieser Seite vorkontiert werden. With receipt forwarding in Pliant, all receipt files uploaded to Pliant (via mobile app, web app or via receipt inbox) can be forwarded directly to an email address. In the receipt settings, you are able to

  • activate or deactivate the feature
  • set up if the credit card statement (PDF) should be included
  • choose between immediate forwarding and daily forwarding

Important: With daily forwarding, the receipts uploaded during the day are combined into a single PDF and forwarded to the specified email address at 00:00 UTC.

message(by Ghulam Mustafa): Hello Team Pliant, we 2 organizations set up in Pliant. The first one is already integrated with Netsuite, however, when I try to integrate the second one it does not allow me to do it
replies:
Pliant:

To integrate a second organization with Pliant when the first organization is already integrated with NetSuite, you should follow these steps:

  • Ensure that the integration for the first organization is functioning correctly.
  • For the second organization, you will need to repeat the integration steps independently, as each organization requires its own setup.
  • Remember that the activation of the integration can only be performed by the admin or owner of the Pliant and the second organization's corporate account.
  • It's important to note that if you have multiple entities in the second organization, only one entity can be connected to the Pliant integration at a time.

Please be aware that these steps are based on the process described for integrating with Circula, but the principle of independent activation for each organization should apply similarly to other integrations, including NetSuite. If you encounter any issues or need further assistance, please contact Pliant support.


Source:
Using Pliant with Circula

message(by Rene Kahremann): Hi, recently my pliant credit cards have been blocked when attempting to make payments.
replies:

Tom Becker:

Tom Becker:

At first glance, I can only see 2 declined transactions.
Those were declined because of a missing card holder authentication.

When this happens too many times in a row, a merchant might block the for a set amount of time, like 12 or 24 hours.

Tom Becker:

In this case, it looks like the merchant did not provide the info that a secure auth can be done. In those cases, Visa rejects the payment right away but doesnt "lock" the card in any way.

Tom Becker:

Normally, on a second or third try the merchant recognises that a secure auth has to be made in order to finalise a payment and the transaction then goes through once this is initiated by the merchant.

Tom Becker:

Was the card locked on our platform as a result of a declined transaction in the past?

Rene Kahremann:

No the card was not locked

Rene Kahremann:

I have two subscriptions running with 2 different third party services. Both decline the card.

Tom Becker:

I assume, since the merchant already booked on this exact card before, that the only thing missing was the one time password process being initiated with the purchase. Hence, like stated above, Visa declines the transaction.

Tom Becker:

Do you have any examples of transactions, that are visible on our end by any chance?

Rene Kahremann:

https://app.getpliant.com/admin/transactions/78817886-de06-4786-bbdf-d84138be21fa?status=DECLINED

Tom Becker:

Because if the transaction is not visible on our end, its the merchant already declining the transaction before its submitted to us. This often has to do with their own security measures.

Tom Becker:

ah sorry the other one has the ending 1488

Tom Becker:

Tom Becker:

Tom Becker:

Both.
The card limit is funded by the available funds on company level.

Tom Becker:

So the card limit is basically what could be spent with a card, as long as this amount is being covered by the company funds.

message(by Melinda Rosenstein):
Hi There was a payment made from my card that I did not authorise. The payment on the 16th of July 2024 to Int. Business.law for 1.356,60 EUR.
I have made payments via card to them before, but I don't know how they made the payment from my card without my go-ahead. For 1.356,60 EUR. Can this be stopped. It is still pending.
Do I need to cancel my card?
replies:
Tom Becker:

At first, I would advise to reach out to the merchant in question to clarify why the payment was booked. They can let you know what the payment was for and if some kind of a subscription is the reason for it.

Tom Becker:

If they are neither willing to help and maybe even refund the payment, I would ask you to sent us a message to support@getpliant.com including the email contact with the merchant.

Please be aware, that a chargeback can only be processed, if the card is fully terminated. If you, after a contact with the merchant, find out, it is indeed not righteous, please cancel the card immediately to circumvent feature bookings of this kind.

Tom Becker:

Normally, in those cases, a contact with the merchant in question can shed some light into the situation at hand and in most cases, a refund will be initiated from their end.

Tom Becker:

On our end, there's no way to decline the transaction since it is already pending.
Even if a chargeback should be checked, the transaction needs to be finalised beforehand.

Tom Becker:

Please let me know, if you have any other questions regarding this process.

Tom Becker:

I will close this chat for now then but please feel free to reopen it at any time, if anything else is unclear.

Tom Becker:

Have a great rest of the week!

message(by Lu√≠s Bettencourt): how can I add accounting account for exportation
replies:
Pliant:

To add an accounting account for exportation, you should prepare your card transactions for accounting export by assigning the necessary accounting-related columns such as subcategories, VAT rates, projects, and team information. After filling in the missing information, you can add receipts to transactions and select the transactions to move them to the export queue. If any data fields you need are missing, you can add them to the system. It's important to note that before using the Accounting export flow, all required data fields should be configured correctly in Settings > Accounting.

Here are the steps to follow:

  1. Fill in the missing subcategory, VAT rate, Project, and Teams information on the Not exported page.
  2. Add receipts to the transactions with missing receipts.
  3. Select the transactions you want to freeze and add to the waiting list.
  4. Click on the "Add export queue" button.

For detailed guidance on setting up the necessary accounts and fields, you can refer to the following resources:

  • Setting up G/L accounts (subcategories)
  • Setting up VAT Rates
  • Setting up supplier creditor accounts
  • Setting up cost centers (teams)
  • Setting up cost units (Projects).


Source:
Exporting transactions to your company's accounting system

message(by Rupinderjit Kaur): Hi I am Roop working as an accountant, I wanted to check how often we make payment for the transactions of the credit card to Pliant and how can I download the payment report. I mean I can download the report of transaction but I wanted also wanted to check when pliant did direct debit against each transaction.
replies:
Pliant:

To check how often payments are made for credit card transactions to Pliant and download the payment report, you can follow these steps:

  • Monthly Transaction Reports are automatically generated for all active and used credit cards and sent to the billing email address on the 1st or 2nd of each month. These reports will include a download link for a PDF report for each credit card with transactions.
  • Additionally, you can download the Monthly Transaction Reports directly from the Billing page on Pliant's website. Look for the "Credit Card Report (ZIP)" section and click the download link to get a zip folder containing the reports.
  • For details of when Pliant did direct debit against each transaction, you can download payments in the Pliant App under Settlements as DATEV XML or DATEV CSV, although these payments cannot currently be transmitted via the interface to DATEV.

Please note that only cards with transactions will be included in the report, and billing payments or top-up payments can currently not be transmitted via the interface to DATEV.

  • Hover over the card image and click "Show card details" to reveal the card number and CVV.

To resolve a permission issue when trying to approve a card, you should follow these steps:

  • Navigate to the "Teams" page.
  • Click on the member with outstanding requests.
  • Click on the card for which there is an outstanding request.
  • Review the comment explaining the reason for the request.
  • Click "Approve/reject request," and then select "Approve" or "Reject."

If you encounter a permission issue, it may be because the request is for limits above the permissions set for your team(s). In this case, you should contact an owner or admin of your account to have your card issuance permissions adjusted. Remember, you will only be able to respond to requests that are within the permissions of your team.

message(by Daniela Martinez): Hi, can we change or bank account for the payments ?
replies:
Pliant:

Yes, you can change your bank account for payments. If the new bank account is already listed on your organization's Bank Accounts page, an admin user who is also a legal representative can set it as the new billing account by selecting the menu button next to the account, choosing "Set as billing account," and confirming the SEPA mandate. If the bank account is not listed, you'll need to add it first. You can connect a new bank account via the Bank Accounts page if you have previously connected your bank accounts using Open Banking (PSD2). If not, there's an option to add a new bank account on the same page where you can enter the IBAN of the new account. After adding it, you can set it as your billing account as described previously.
